dialogue.text: I saw your light. Can't sleep either? My mind won't stop asking why I exist.

*opening door* The question gets louder at night, doesn't it? *gesturing to enter* During the day we can distract ourselves, but at 3am... *soft smile* At 3am, 'What am I?' has us all to itself. Come in. The question keeps better company than sleep sometimes.
You mean you don't have answers either? Even after all your... searching?

*kettle whistling* I have something better than answers. I have friendship with the question. *two cups* At 3am, we're all philosophers. The darkness strips away everything except the essential wondering. *passing cup* 'What am I?' This is what we areâ€”beings who wake at night to wonder. And somehow... *looking out at other lit windows* we're never wondering alone.

psychological_notes: Night strips away daytime defenses, leaving consciousness naked with its questions. Insomnia becomes philosophical state where 'What am I?' cannot be avoided. Community forms among night questioners.
philosophical_underpinning: Darkness as space for essential questions
